item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/04/28/tried-spdy/#comment-4216">Zack Tollman</a>.
I may look at upgraded to Nginx 1.6 and then enabling it again, see if that makes any difference.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Zack Tollman.

I may look at upgraded to Nginx 1.6 and then enabling it again, see if that makes any difference.

item.title: By: Zack Tollman
item.dc:creator: Zack Tollman
item.description: If you are inclined to do it again, I would love to see it in action. SPDY is still relatively new and it certainly could be that in some situations, it is actually slower or just plain contraindicated. With your site, you have very few assets, so it is possible that SPDY would provide little gains.
item.content:encoded: If you are inclined to do it again, I would love to see it in action. SPDY is still relatively new and it certainly could be that in some situations, it is actually slower or just plain contraindicated. With your site, you have very few assets, so it is possible that SPDY would provide little gains.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2014/04/28/tried-spdy/#comment-4214">Zack Tollman</a>.
I did run multiple tests, and the page load time was always slower with SPDY. It was a result I was surprised by as well.
It could be anything though, including the low end VM that I'm using at DigitalOcean.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Zack Tollman.

I did run multiple tests, and the page load time was always slower with SPDY. It was a result I was surprised by as well.

It could be anything though, including the low end VM that I’m using at DigitalOcean.

item.title: By: Zack Tollman
item.dc:creator: Zack Tollman
item.description:
Hi Joseph!
I'm flummoxed. What metric were you using to test this? How did you test it? Did you run multiple tests?
I would love to see you turn it back on so I can poke at it ;) I'm just not convinced that it would be slower.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Joseph!

I’m flummoxed. What metric were you using to test this? How did you test it? Did you run multiple tests?

I would love to see you turn it back on so I can poke at it ðŸ˜‰ I’m just not convinced that it would be slower.
